results.title: Chaps on Tour 2011 [Short version]
results.brief_description: A specially made abridged version of the amazing ‘Chaps On Tour’ film, made by Toby Segar - at the age of just 16. Toby and his six friends set out to capture an image of their lives: fun and friendship driven by their mutual love of Parkour.

results.title: You don't belong here [game trailer]
results.brief_description:
By staying true to your own ideals you will find a group of unique individuals where everyone belongs. A man is shipwrecked on a distant island. He must search the island for a tribe to live in by avoiding obstacles and collecting gems along the way. These tribes will take you in but on the condition you behave like them. You decline their offer saying you have a right to be yourself. You are then banished and must avoid members of these tribes as you continue your search. They attempt to catch you as you dont belong. Finally you come across a tribe that accepts you for who you are. They are all individuals and make you feel like you belong.

Under the category ‘Primary Videogames’, Liam Blake, Hope Valley, SA, was the Screen It 2012 winner.

results.title: Green Fingers: Indoor Plants
results.brief_description:
‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Indoor Plants’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to propagate and look after indoor plants.

The film contains wonderful footage of the glasshouses at Burnley Horticultural College, with plants shown including rubber plants, philodendron and rex begonias. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: Mots' Mansion [videogame trailer]
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Middle Videogame category. Sam, Bec and their Mother move in to Grandma’s house. But when Bec is captured, Sam needs to complete tasks given to him by the mysterious MOTS. Can he trust the Man on the Stairs and will they both make it out. In the end, the choices you make will matter.

results.title: The Pizzini Family
results.creator_credit: Matt Blackwood, Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a story about an Italian-Australian family made unique by three generations of winemakers and master chefs. Meet Natalie, Alfred, Arnold, Katrina, Carla and matriarch Rosetta Pizzini, hear about the four brothers that immigrated to Australia and started farming tobacco, eventually diversifying to growing Italian variety grapes. The Pizzini’s make their own wine, run a cooking school and manage a boutique hotel in Whitfield, but still the most important part of their day is when they sit together and share a meal, a glass of wine and a laugh.

results.title: Qesa: stories from the Craig Family Centre
results.brief_description: The African nation of Sudan has suffered the longest periods of sustained civil war in history. In this compilation of digital stories, women from North and South Sudan recount their experience of war, migration and settlement in Australia.

results.title: The Drip
results.brief_description: No matter what the doting Helmut does, his wife Gertrude is never satisfied. But things are about to change. When an ever-increasing drip starts falling from the sky onto Gertrude’s head, it’s Helmut to the rescue!

results.title: Green Fingers: Planting Evergreens
results.brief_description: ‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Planting Evergreens’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to correctly plant evergreen trees and shrubs in your garden, accompanied by a narrator explaining the method and techniques. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.
results.description: Green Fingers was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Planting Evergreens’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to correctly plant evergreen trees and shrubs in your garden, accompanied by a narrator explaining the method and techniques. The episodes of Green Fingers are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of Sow What, Better Homes and Gardens, and Gardening Australia.

In this episode, ‘Planting Evergreens’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to correctly plant evergreen trees and shrubs in your garden, accompanied by a narrator explaining the method and techniques. The episodes of Green Fingers are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of Sow What, Better Homes and Gardens, and Gardening Australia.
